text: Marlèn Nolta (30 June 1955 – 11 January 2022) was a Dutch illustrator and drawer. Nolta studied at the Gerrit Rietveld Academie and . In 1981 an exhibition was held including sepia drawings of Nolta. She became in the 1980s a succesfull cartoonist for national newspapers and magazines, including NRC Handelsblad, Elsevier and Het Parool. She made cartoons for the news item, with a few catchy words. She also drew book covers. Nolta also made own work. Nolta became a bookseller at Boekhandel van Pampus in Amsterdam. Nolta died in Amsterdam on 11 January 2022, at the age of 66. ==References== ==Other websites== *Find newspaper cartoons of Nolta - via Delpher Category:Dutch artists Category:illustrators Category:1955 births Category:2022 deaths Category:People from Groningen (city)
title: Marlèn Nolta
